events.title: Australia news live: minister refutes ‘troubling’ claim by Bragg that Muslims bear responsibility for Bondi shooting; bushfire smoke over Sydney
events.description: Pat Conroy says Muslim community are ‘incredibly valued Australians’. Follow today’s news live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The minister for defence industry, Pat Conroy , has refuted claims made by shadow frontbencher Andrew Bragg about the Muslim community. Earlier Bragg accused Australia’s Muslim community of needing to “take some responsibility” for the Bondi terror attack and for the federal government to make sure funding doesn’t go to “hate preachers”. We’ve been very clear these acts were committed by people who believed an extreme perversion of Islam and to try and hold the entire Islamic community responsible for these acts, I think, is anti to social cohesion. It’s incredibly unfair, and it’s not a recipe for taking this country forward. Some of the earliest people condemning the vile attacks in Bondi were leaders of our Muslim Australian community, and we’ll continue to support their right to practise in peace. Continue reading...

events.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
events.description: More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters. More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain . Continue reading...

events.title: London-based Persian TV aims to air 'truth' about Iran protests
events.description: It deems itself to be the voice of truth for all Iranians: 'Iran International' is a private Persian-language news channel based in London that has been declared a terrorist organisation by Tehran. Since its creation in 2017, it is one of the only reliable sources of information that Iranians can access via satellite and private VPNs and is a prime target of Iranian authorities. FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes reports.

events.title: 'Doomsday Clock' ticks closer to midnight over global threats, group says
events.description: Doomsday Clock moves to 85 seconds to midnight as scientists warn of nuclear war, climate change and AI threats bringing humanity closer to catastrophe.

events.title: UN chief warns ‘law of the jungle’ is replacing rule of law
events.description: Warning that the “rule of law is being replaced by the law of the jungle,” the UN Secretary-General on Monday urged world powers to recommit to international law as the foundation of peace, justice and multilateral cooperation.

events.title: UNESCO warns of alarming rise in antisemitism and Holocaust denial in classrooms across the EU
events.description: Nadia Massih is pleased to welcome Heather Mann, Project Officer at UNESCO’s Section for Global Citizenship and Peace Education. On International Holocaust Remembrance Day, Ms. Mann shares her findings of an extensive UNESCO report, a year in the making, on antisemitism in European schools. Based on surveys with roughly 2,000 teachers across the EU, UNESCO is calling is for structured teacher training and targeted educational resources to confront both historical understanding and contemporary manifestations of antisemitism.

events.title: Japanese have 'greater awareness of security issues and a greater concern over actions by China'
events.description: Hundreds ‍of Japanese ​panda lovers bid an emotional farewell to the country's last two giant pandas, Xiao ⁠Xiao and Lei Lei, as they left Tokyo's Ueno Zoo for China on Tuesday. Their departure leaves Japan with no pandas for the first time in half a century, and the chances of getting a replacement are poor, with Tokyo's relations with Beijing at their lowest point in years. We speak with Kristi Govella, senior adviser and Japan Chair at the Centre for Strategic and International Studies.

events.title: US naval buildup in Middle East heightens tensions
events.description: Iran, Houthi rebels, and Hezbollah are reacting to the increased U.S. military presence in the Middle East. The arrival of a US aircraft carrier comes amid violent protests in Iran and threats of U.S. strikes. According to FRANCE 24's Philip Turle, Trump is pressuring Iran but does not want a war; he sees this as a chance to push for a deal on Iran’s nuclear program, especially during an election year.

events.title: Guardian Essential poll: One Nation’s primary vote soars to record high amid Coalition chaos
events.description: Pauline Hanson’s party polls a primary vote of 22%, while Labor’s response to the Bondi terror attack wins widespread support Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast One Nation’s polling surge has continued with a record-high primary vote of 22% in the latest Guardian Essential poll off the back of ongoing Coalition chaos and rising social tensions. Meanwhile, there is widespread public support for the Labor government’s response to the Bondi beach terror attack, with a majority backing crackdowns on guns, hate speech and protests. However, most poll respondents say Anthony Albanese has poorly handled the fallout from the antisemitic shooting. Continue reading...

events.title: Remembering the Holocaust: ‘You are here because you choose hope over hate’
events.description: The Holocaust is a warning, that hatred “can consume everything” – a message that feels more urgent than ever, the UN chief said on Tuesday, as antisemitism rages worldwide.

events.title: World News in Brief: Iran in the Human Rights Council, Myanmar election ‘fraud’, migration chief in Cyprus, Mozambique flood update
events.description: Disturbing details continued to emerge on Friday about Iran’s State-led crackdown against mass protests, while UN rights chief Volker Türk expressed deep concern that demonstrators could be executed.

events.title: Iran regime reportedly issued nationwide shoot-to-kill orders as protest death toll surges
events.description: Iran protest death toll estimates range from several thousand to over 35,000 as brutal crackdown intensifies. Medical data reveals shocking scale of violence.

events.title: The Trader Joe's tote bag goes global
events.description: Trader Joe's tote bags have become all the rage overseas. Why have the supermarket chain's bags become an international fashion statement?

events.title: Iran: Victim numbers rise as US announces military drills
events.description: A US-based group said the number of people killed in the protests against the regime in Iran has exceeded 6,100. US war ships have reached the region, with an IRCG official warning neighbors against aiding any strikes.

events.title: West Virginia man allegedly threatened to kill Trump supporters, ICE agents in online videos: report
events.description: West Virginia man allegedly posted videos threatening Trump supporters and ICE agents, police say. Cody Smith, 20, arrested on terroristic charges.

events.title: How Israel’s West Bank security realities are reshaping the two-state debate
events.description: The West Bank remains central to Israel's security strategy as experts debate two-state solution viability following declining Palestinian terrorist incidents.

events.title: Through the heatwave haze, the hypocrisy of Australia’s fossil fuel policy shines bright | Clean Air
events.description: The heatwave in Melbourne and Adelaide this week is likely to become the norm. We should prepare now Want to get this in your inbox when it publishes? Sign up for the Clear Air Australia newsletter here On Tuesday, Australia’s second-largest city baked through one of its hottest days since modern instrumental records began in 1910. Several Melbourne suburbs topped 45C. The country’s fifth-largest city, Adelaide, reached that temperature on Monday. Its residents then suffered through their hottest night ever, with a minimum of about 34C. Remote communities were even harder hit. It was was 48.9C in Hopetoun and Walpeup in Victoria’s north-west, and 49.6C in Renmark, over the South Australian border. An out-of-control bushfire burned in the Otways region, south-west of Melbourne, near areas that just two weeks ago faced flash flooding. Sign up to get climate and environment editor Adam Morton’s Clear Air column as a free newsletter Continue reading...

events.title: At least 6,126 people killed in Iran's crackdown on nationwide protests, activists say
events.description: Iran's bloody crackdown on nationwide protests killed at least 6,126 people while many others still are feared dead, activists said Tuesday, as a U.S. aircraft carrier group arrived in the Mideast to lead any American military response to the crisis.

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‘risks global safety’, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: Indonesia’s Flood Catastrophe | The Full Report
events.description: A deadly cyclone hits Indonesia’s Sumatra, wiping out communities. Al Jazeera examines the scale of destruction.

events.title: UK supermarkets push for Amazon soy safeguards after traders abandon ban
events.description: European retailers urge traders to adhere to commitments after Brazilian lawmakers wreck forest protection pact Leading British and European retailers are trying to salvage the core elements of the Amazon soy moratorium after the world’s most successful forest protection agreement was wrecked by Brazilian lawmakers and abandoned by international traders. In an open letter, high street brands including Tesco, Sainsbury’s and Asda say the breakdown this month of the 20-year-old agreement will damage consumer confidence unless new arrangements are put in place to ensure grain production is not linked to deforestation. Continue reading...

events.title: Femicides in Brazil at record high in 2025
events.description: A recent study shows that femicides have risen in Brazil, reaching record levels in 2025, with an average of four women killed each day. France 24 correspondent Jan Onoszko explains that the increase is partly due to more murders being officially recognized and recorded as femicides, rather than being classified as ordinary homicides. Violence against women has been rising sharply since 2017, and the home is now seen as the most dangerous place, with many women attacked by their partners.

events.title: Russian drones kill 1 and injure children in Ukraine as Zelenskyy urges speedier diplomacy
events.description: A heavy Russian drone attack on Odesa has killed at least one person and injured 23, including children and a pregnant woman

events.title: World pauses to commemorate International Holocaust Remembrance Day
events.description: People across Europe and beyond are commemorating International Holocaust Remembrance Day

events.title: ‘We must stand up for our shared humanity - each and every day’: UN human rights chief
events.description: On the eve of International Holocaust Remembrance Day, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called on the global community to “not only to look at our past, but to reflect on our present, and to safeguard our future.”

events.title: South Sudan: UN and rights experts warn against risk of mass violence in Jonglei
events.description: The UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) is sounding the alarm over the threat of escalating violence in Jonglei state which is putting lives at risk and further weakening prospects for peace.

events.title: UN rights chief decries US treatment of migrants, as deaths in ICE custody rise
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official has raised alarm over what he described as the growing dehumanisation of migrants in the United States, warning that current immigration enforcement practices are undermining due process, family unity and basic human dignity.

events.title: Iranian drone swarms pose 'credible threat' to USS Abraham Lincoln carrier group, defense expert says
events.description: USS Abraham Lincoln strike group approaches Middle East amid warnings that Iranian drone capabilities worth "tens of millions of dollars" threaten U.S. naval vessels.

events.title: Border Patrol involved in Arizona shooting, one person injured, local authorities say
events.description: A shooting involving the U.S. Border Patrol prompted a law enforcement response in Arizona’s Arivaca area on Tuesday, local authorities said.

events.title: Iranian security forces gun down amateur boxer near Tehran: source
events.description: Iranian security forces allegedly killed amateur boxer Sepehr Ebrahimi during ongoing protests near Tehran. The death adds to Iran's rising protest toll of at least 6,126 people killed.

events.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: State of emergency declared as Russia brings its war into Ukrainian homes
events.description: The sound of deep, slow breaths echoes up a frozen staircase, followed by footsteps.

events.title: Anger as branch of ICE to help with security at Winter Olympics in Italy
events.description: A branch of the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) will help with security for the Winter Olympics in Italy, it confirmed Tuesday, sparking anger and warnings they were not welcome. Reports had been circulating for days that the agency embroiled in an often brutal immigration crackdown in the United States could be involved in US security measures for the February 6-22 Games in northern Italy.

events.title: At least 6,126 people killed in Iran’s crackdown on nationwide protests, activists say
events.description: Activists say that at least 6,126 people were killed in Iran’s crackdown on nationwide protests and many more are still feared dead

events.title: Repeat offender on parole for murder tied to brutal jail assault, escape hours after robbery
events.description: Murder parolee Edmound Guillory allegedly cut ankle monitor before CVS robbery and jail escape. The 19-year-old Texas teen was reportedly convicted in 2022 fatal shooting but released early.

events.title: Chinese spies 'sham marriage' scandal exposes 'targeted' national security threat at major US base: expert
events.description: Former CIA operative warns alleged Navy sailor "sham marriage" scandal with Chinese nationals exposes serious national security threat.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
events.description: Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: USS Abraham Lincoln Aircraft Carrier Strike Group makes move amid threat from Iran
events.description: USS Abraham Lincoln entered CENTCOM waters Monday amid escalating threats from Iran and the potential for a "credible" drone attack on the U.S.

events.title: Philippines' Duterte fit to face ICC proceedings, judges say
events.description: The 80-year-old is accused of crimes of humanity over his bloody war on drugs that left thousands killed.

events.title: Netanyahu vows to disarm Hamas, demilitarise Gaza after last hostage returned
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel would now focus on disarming Hamas and demilitarising Gaza following the return of the last hostage from the territory, warning that no reconstruction would be allowed until those goals were achieved and reiterating his opposition to Palestinian statehood in Gaza.

events.title: How AI-generated images are being used to deny the massacre of protesters in Iran
events.description: After a widely-shared image showing hundreds of bodies piled up in a morgue in Tehran turned out to have been AI-generated, supporters of the Iranian regime have been using the picture to cast doubt on a real photo taken in the same morgue.

events.title: 'What do you want from me?' Captain in fatal ship collision asks prosecutor
events.description: A captain has been confronted in a trial over the "serious and obvious" risk of death posed when his container ship collided with an anchored US oil tanker.

events.title: UN envoy highlights ‘window to advance peace’ in Colombia
events.description: The new year provides an opportunity for Colombia to keep advancing towards lasting peace, a decade after a landmark accord that ended more than 50 years of conflict, the UN Special Representative told the Security Council on Friday.

events.title: What ICE is doing to America is familiar to me as a Palestinian
events.description: Today Americans are getting a taste of what Palestinians have experienced for decades: state terror.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.description: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party leadership.

events.title: FBI’s Kash Patel falsely claims Americans ‘cannot bring firearms’ to protests
events.description: FBI Director Kash Patel was accused of not knowing the law, after falsely claiming protesters cannot carry firearms to demonstrations, following the killing of ICU nurse Alex Pretti by ICE agents in Minneapolis. His statement outraged gun rights groups across the US - including the NRA - who argue it’s a Second Amendment right to bear arms, and Pretti had a legal license to carry a handgun. Vedika Bahl explains in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Holocaust survivor, 93, bears witness for young 'messengers of peace'
events.description: Lili Keller-Rosenberg has been sharing her story with young people for more than 40 years. Born into a French Jewish family with Hungarian origins, she was captured in Roubaix when she was 11 years old. Deported to Ravensbrück concentration camp and then Bergen-Belsen, she miraculously survived with her mother and two little brothers. FRANCE 24 met her to mark International Holocaust Remembrance Day.

events.title: ‘Cycle of attacks must end’: Lead UN official in Ukraine
events.description: The senior UN official in Ukraine, Matthias Schmale, has issued a condemnation of the massive overnight Russian drone and missile strike on several major Ukrainian cities, killing and injuring civilians, and knocking out energy infrastructure amid sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Retired NYPD officer collapses, dies shoveling snow for churchgoers during devastating Northeast winter storm
events.description: Retired NYPD sergeant Roger McGovern, 60, reportedly died of heart attack while shoveling snow at his Long Island church preparing for Sunday mass.

events.title: China slams Trump administration over US sanctions on Cuba
events.description: China strongly condemns U.S. pressure on Cuba, calling sanctions violations of international law as diplomatic tensions escalate over decades-long embargo.

events.title: Chinese hackers reportedly breached phones at 'heart of Downing Street' in global spy campaign
events.description: Chinese state-linked hackers reportedly breached phones "at the heart of Downing Street," and allegedly accessed the phone data of millions.

events.title: ‘Very low bar’: analysts say Starmer faces slim pickings in China
events.description: Experts say business with China is always a double-edged sword let alone when its overheated economy can offer only marginal gains Starmer vows to remain ‘clear-eyed’ over national security as he flies to China Keir Starmer’s trip to China is billed as an attempt to revitalise diplomatic relations but eight years after Theresa May paved the way for a never-materialised “ambitious” post-Brexit deal, the prospect of the prime minister landing any meaningful trade deal is slim, experts have warned. The visit to Beijing, involving a delegation of British companies led by Starmer, the chancellor, Rachel Reeves, and the business secretary, Peter Kyle, is the first since May’s 2018 visit, and will revolve around joint trade and investment efforts. Continue reading...

events.title: French PM Lecornu survives no-confidence votes as budget moves forward
events.description: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu on Tuesday survived two new no-confidence votes after forcing his budget through the National Assembly, France's lower house of parliament, clearing a key hurdle towards its final adoption.

events.title: Texas teen dies after Jeep-pulled sled strikes curb and tree during severe winter storm
events.description: Teen dies in sledding accident involving Jeep in Frisco, Texas, authorities said. Another 16-year-old remains critical after sled struck curb, hit tree.

events.title: 'We all know someone who was killed' -  Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
events.description: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

events.title: Families sue US over deadly boat strike off Venezuela coast
events.description: Relatives of Chad Joseph and Rishi Samaroo - among six killed on 14 October - say the Trinidadian men were returning home when their vessel was hit.

events.title: Firefighters battle 'emergency level' blazes in Australia heatwave
events.description: Firefighters in Victoria are battling at least six major fires amid a record-breaking heatwave.

events.title: Why is Pakistan backing Bangladesh in its T20 World Cup row with India?
events.description: Regional politics at the fore after Bangladesh ousted from the T20 World Cup in India.

events.title: Heat records tumble in Victoria as authorities warn against complacency amid significant blazes
events.description: BoM to check if Walpeup and Hopetoun broke state’s official heat record - set during 2009’s Black Saturday What happens to the human body in 49C heat? Australians are finding out Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victoria may have sweltered through its hottest temperatures on record, with preliminary readings of 48.9C at two locations in the state’s north-west both higher than that recorded during 2009’s Black Saturday . According to initial data recorded by the Bureau of Meteorology, the Mallee towns of Hopetoun and Walpeup reached 48.9C on Tuesday afternoon. This would exceed the previous highest temperature of 48.8C, recorded at Hopetoun on 7 February 2009. Continue reading...

events.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
events.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

events.title: Workers from Bangladesh sought jobs in Russia but got sent to combat in Ukraine
events.description: An Associated Press investigation found that Bangladeshi workers were lured to Russia by the false promise of civilian jobs and thrust onto the battlefield in the Ukraine war

events.title: From deepfakes to grooming: UN warns of escalating AI threats to children
events.description: The staggering amount of harmful AI-generated online content has prompted an urgent call from across the UN system for a raft of measures to protect children from abuse, exploitation and mental trauma.

events.title: Well-known Texas attorney’s wife among victims of deadly private jet crash in Maine
events.description: Family and friends identified the victims of a deadly Maine plane crash that killed six people aboard a private jet at Bangor airport Sunday night during takeoff.

events.title: SEE IT: Missing teen drives stolen SUV over 115 mph, crosses into oncoming traffic before rollover crash
events.description: Teen driver allegedly reaches 115+ mph in stolen SUV before rollover crash. Dashcam video shows dangerous high-speed chase along Georgia roads.

events.title: Virginia school safety director charged with DUI after winter storm
events.description: Arlington Public Schools employee Aaron Queen was charged with a DUI after a winter storm incident. The district says it's cooperating with a police investigation.

events.title: Netanyahu sounds alarm on antisemitism at Holocaust Remembrance Day gathering
events.description: Antisemitism surge prompts leaders to gather in Jerusalem for Holocaust Remembrance Day conference. Netanyahu warns ideology threatens Western civilization.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
events.description: Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian. “It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email. Continue reading...

events.title: Minnesota: Trump wants 'honorable' probe into Pretti killing
events.description: Facing nationwide backlash, Donald Trump described the killing of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis as "very sad." Meanwhile, a planned visit by ICE members has stirred controversy in Italy. DW has more.

events.title: Flooding hammers Mozambique, southern African neighbors
events.description: Weeks of heavy rainfall have caused severe floods across southern Africa, with Mozambique and South Africa among the hardest hit. Rising water has destroyed infrastructure, affecting 1.3 million people.

events.title: Families of Kenyans lured into Russia-Ukraine war seek state intervention for repatriation
events.description: In tonight's edition, the families of Kenyans fighting for Russia in its invasion of Ukraine are demanding that their loved ones be brought back home. Also, white farmers in Zimbabwe hire a US lobbying firm as they court President Donald Trump's help in chasing their government for billions of dollars in compensation for land seized in the 2000s. And more South African schools are introducing phone-free days.

events.title: Landslide leaves Sicilian town teetering on cliff edge
events.description: More than 1,000 people were evacuated in Sicily after a five-kilometre section of cliff crumbled during a storm, leaving houses perched perilously on the edge, authorities said Monday. Land was continuing to give way due to rain that has soaked the area in recent days, said the mayor of the southern hill town of Niscemi. FRANCE 24's Seema Gupta reports from Rome.

events.title: Canada gives approval for Marineland to export remaining belugas to the US
events.description: Canada’s last captive whales have a received a reprieve from death after the Canadian government conditionally approved a plan to export them to the United States

events.title: World News in Brief: Deadly shipwrecks in the Mediterranean, Duterte trial update, final hostage remains recovered in Gaza, FAO boosts farming in Haiti
events.description: The UN migration agency, IOM, expressed deep concern on Monday over multiple deadly shipwrecks that are believed to have taken place over the past ten days across the Central Mediterranean.

events.title: Gaza reconstruction talks must not distract from massive needs, say UN aid agencies
events.description: Amid reconstruction talks on Gaza linked to President Trump's just-launched Board of Peace, UN aid agencies insisted on Friday that what Gazans need most is immediate relief from the ongoing humanitarian catastrophe there.

events.title: Iran’s currency, the rial, falls to 1.5 million to $1, a record low after nationwide protests sparked by economic woes
events.description: Iran’s currency, the rial, falls to 1.5 million to $1, a record low after nationwide protests sparked by economic woes

events.title: A ceasefire holds in Syria but civilians live with fear and resentment
events.description: A fragile ceasefire between Syria's government and Kurdish-led forces has temporarily eased tensions in the country's northeast

events.title: FBI investigating Minnesota anti-ICE Signal group chats, Patel says
events.description: FBI Director Kash Patel announces investigation into alleged Signal group chats used by anti-ICE activists to track federal agents in Minneapolis.

events.title: Skier suffers brutal mauling after stepping within 10 feet of snow leopard for photo, video shows
events.description: Female skier survives snow leopard mauling in China's Fuyun County after authorities warned tourists about predator sightings near hotel, according to reports.

events.title: China experts raise alarms over Xi’s sweeping military purge
events.description: Military turmoil in China raises Taiwan invasion concerns as Xi Jinping removes senior officers. Analysts warn of growing instability despite control.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Guyanese businessman facing US extradition elected opposition leader
events.description: Azruddin Mohamed’s election comes six months after he formed political party that became country’s second largest A Guyanese businessman facing extradition to the US on gold-smuggling and money-laundering charges has been elected as the country’s opposition leader, six months after he formed a political party that quickly became the second largest in the South American country . Azruddin Mohamed, 38, was confirmed as Guyana’s opposition leader after 16 lawmakers from the We Invest in Nationhood party (Win) and another from a single-seat outfit voted in his favor. The tally made Win the second-largest party in parliament, securing Mohamed’s election even as a magistrate’s court hears state arguments for his extradition to the US. Continue reading...

events.title: Police release new photos of vehicle as search for alleged Lake Cargelligo shooter continues – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Heat records tumble in Victoria as authorities warn against complacency amid significant blazes Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victoria to open nation’s first offshore wind auction this year Australia’s first offshore wind auction is set to kick off this year, with the Victorian Government announcing it would invite tenders for 2 gigawatts of capacity in August. We want to give industry the certainty it needs to invest and help us keep building the renewable energy Victoria needs to push down energy bills. Continue reading...

events.title: U.S. strikes on alleged drug boats have done little to stop the flow of illegal drugs
events.description: Despite dozens of lethal U.S. military strikes on suspected narco-boats, drug flows continue, allies are alarmed, and Caribbean fishermen say their livelihoods are under threat.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.description: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: German FA believe World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.description: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Doomsday Clock moved closer to midnight than ever: What is it and how does it work?
events.description: The Doomsday Clock has been moved closer than ever to midnight by scientists, a change that is said to signify that we are edging closer to the end of the world.

events.title: Young people must be ‘truly involved’ in transforming education
events.description: With young people under 30 making up more than half of the global population and over 272 million children and youth still out of school, their participation in shaping education is becoming increasingly vital.

events.title: Emory fires Iranian official's daughter after campus protests over controversial hiring decision
events.description: Fatemeh Ardeshir-Larijani, daughter of sanctioned Iranian official Ali Larijani, lost her position at Emory University as activists called for review of her immigration status.

events.title: Deadly US winter storm leaves flights delayed and thousands without power
events.description: At least a dozen people have died in multiple US states possibly due to the storm, officials have said.

events.title: Will Palestinians ever find their loved ones in Gaza’s rubble?
events.description: Thousands are missing as Israel blocks machinery essential for the search.

events.title: Iran president tells Saudi crown prince that US threats cause instability
events.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian emphasised that regional instability 'benefits no one' during the call.

events.title: Meet Hamza Al-Rubaie, one of Gaza’s 17,000 orphaned children
events.description: Hamza Al-Rubaie is one of at least 17,000 children to have lost both parents in Israel’s genocidal war on Gaza.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
events.description: Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities. Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
events.description: Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative Five-year-old Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country Génesis had never known. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Gutiérrez, 26, issued in 2019, before Génesis was born. Continue reading...

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: Philippines grounds company's fleet of passenger ships after at least 18 die in ferry sinking
events.description: Philippine officials have grounded the entire fleet of passenger ships belonging to a company that owned a ferry that sank in the south and left at least 18 people dead, with more than 300 others rescued

events.title: North Korea launches suspected ballistic missiles toward the sea, neighbors say
events.description: North Korea has launched short-range ballistic missiles into the sea

events.title: South Korea says North Korea has launched an unidentified projectile toward the sea
events.description: South Korea says North Korea has launched an unidentified projectile toward the sea

events.title: Between fear and survival: Women and girls flee violence in northern Syria
events.description: When fighting recently intensified near her neighbourhood in Aleppo, in northern Syria, Fatima and her family had to run.

events.title: Keeping people warm amid hostilities and harsh winter weather in Ukraine
events.description: As people in war-torn Ukraine face the coldest winter in more than a decade, authorities and humanitarians are working to help them stay warm, particularly the most vulnerable residents.

events.title: Utah children’s author Kouri Richins says state threatened witnesses ahead of trial in husband’s poisoning
events.description: Utah mother accused of poisoning husband faces witness intimidation claims before murder trial. Defense alleges prosecution threatened witnesses.

events.title: From 700 murdered relatives to 3 survivors: Holocaust descendant leads Israeli forces after Oct 7 attacks
events.description: Israeli colonel whose parents survived Holocaust continues military service at the age of 56, serving over 3,600 days in reserves including Gaza operations.

events.title: A new blow for UNRWA as headquarters in East Jerusalem 'set on fire'
events.description: The head of embattled UN relief agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, has condemned reports that its headquarters in East Jerusalem have been set alight deliberately.

events.title: Los Angeles homeowner opens fire on burglary suspects fleeing in Studio City neighborhood
events.description: A Los Angeles homeowner fired multiple shots at two suspects during attempted burglary in Studio City early Tuesday morning, forcing the pair to flee in SUV.

events.title: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
events.description: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

events.title: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
events.description: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
events.description: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to Cuba Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba , the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not a response to pressure from the US. Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says he will impose new tariffs on South Korea as he criticises delays in trade deal
events.description: US president says tariffs on automobiles, lumber and pharmaceuticals will rise to 25%, accusing Seoul of not living up to a trade deal struck last year Donald Trump has said he is raising tariffs on South Korean goods including automobiles, lumber and pharmaceuticals, accusing the country of not living up to a trade deal struck last year and briefly sending shares in Korean carmakers tumbling. In a post on social media, the US president said the tariffs paid on South Korean exports into America would rise from 15% to 25% because the “Korean Legislature hasn’t enacted our Historic Trade Agreement, which is their prerogative”. Continue reading...

events.title: Sussan Ley has two factors working in her favour as rumours of a Liberal leadership mutiny swirl
events.description: As Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor emerge as likely challengers, two things could buy Ley some time Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast In the chaotic few hours after the Nationals leader, David Littleproud, blew up the Coalition, one thing appeared clear to many Liberal MPs. Sussan Ley’s leadership of the Liberal party was all but over. Continue reading...

events.title: In China, AI is no longer optional for some kids. It's part of the curriculum
events.description: While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it's become a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.

events.title: ICE on US streets challenges American norms, founding values
events.description: The Trump administration has moved ICE's center of activity from the US border with Mexico to the heart of US cities. Federal agents' encounters with the public are challenging the foundational ideas of America.

events.title: Israel's Netanyahu says a Palestinian state in Gaza 'will not happen'
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Tuesday that he would not allow the establishment of a Palestinian state in the Gaza Strip, asserting that Israel would maintain security control "from Jordan to the sea". FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.

events.title: Spain to grant legal status to thousands of immigrants lacking permission
events.description: Spain's government has announced it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization

events.title: Days after a disputed election, Uganda's army is on the hunt for opposition leader Bobi Wine
events.description: A military hunt is underway in Uganda opposition leader Bobi Wine, whom the country's army chief is calling a wanted fugitive

events.title: Independent experts alarmed by child rights violations in US immigration procedures
events.description: UN-appointed independent human rights experts have raised alarm over violations of children’s rights during US immigration procedures, nearly a year after federal funding for legal representation for unaccompanied minors was terminated.

events.title: Federal judge blocks deportation of 5-year-old boy and father taken in Minnesota immigration operation
events.description: A federal judge blocked the deportation of 5-year-old Ecuadorian boy and father detained by immigration authorities in Minnesota last week amid legal challenge.

events.title: Canadian PM Carney denies walking back Davos speech in phone call with Trump
events.description: The Canadian prime minister confirmed that he and the US president spoke by phone after Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Canada.

events.title: Nipah virus outbreak in India triggers Asia airport screenings
events.description: Airports in Thailand and Nepal have begun screening passengers from West Bengal.

events.title: Fate of China’s top general more likely to do with power struggle than corruption
events.description: Experts suggest Xi Jinping is asserting his authority by sidelining an officer who has significantly betrayed his trust Standing inches from Xi Jinping at a military ceremony in late December, China’s highest-ranking general, Zhang Youxia, may have had little inkling about the fate that was to befall him just a few weeks later when he was put under investigation. The 75-year-old’s physical proximity to China’s leader, who stands to his right, reflects the position he holds in China’s hierarchy. As vice-chair of the Central Military Commission (CMC), the ruling body of the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), he is the second-most powerful person in China’s military, after Xi, the commander-in-chief. Continue reading...

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.description: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Sensitive agricultural products excluded from EU - India trade deal
events.description: The EU and India have hailed their new free trade agreement as "the mother of all deals". While the pact eliminates or significantly reduces tariffs on a vast majority of goods traded between the two, it excludes politically sensitive farming products. We'll take a closer look. Also in the segment, some Cypriot fishermen have taken their battle against invasive fish to the dinner table.

events.title: British PM imitates Macron's viral sunglasses moment at Davos
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir #Starmer imitated #Macron's viral sunglasses moment from the #Davos summit. The French President was giving a speech responding to #Trump's threats of tariffs on European countries until they agreed to a US purchase of #Greenland.

events.title: Top rabbi says Europe must do 'much more' to support revolution in Iran
events.description: Europe's most prominent rabbi has told Sky News he holds Iran responsible for the rise of antisemitism in recent years and believes European countries must do much more to support Iranian protesters in overthrowing the Tehran regime.

events.title: Gaza ceasefire improves aid access, but children still face deadly conditions
events.description: The fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip is making a difference to the lives of over a million children, and improving overall access to food - but more aid still needs to enter.

events.title: VCU anti-ICE nurse references paralytic drug in video instructing healthcare providers to 'sabotage' agents
events.description: VCU nurse allegedly posted TikTok videos instructing viewers to use paralytics and poison ivy against ICE agents, prompting a police investigation and administrative leave.

events.title: Minn 'Antifa' member claims he's 'on the run' after calling for 'armed' men to confront immigration officials
events.description: Self-described "Antifa" member Kyle Wagner says he's "on the run" after deleting social accounts following backlash over calls for armed protesters.

events.title: Trump says Iran called 'numerous' times to make deal as carrier enters Middle East waters
events.description: President Donald Trump indicated Iran is seeking negotiations as the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier enters the region and protests continue inside Iran.

events.title: Trump says US will end support for Iraq if al-Maliki reinstated as PM
events.description: Al-Maliki has been nominated by the largest Shia bloc in parliament as its candidate for PM.

events.title: Rwanda sues UK over scrapped asylum seeker deal
events.description: Rwanda began the inter-state arbitration proceedings under the asylum partnership agreement in November.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: 'Voter rolls could be used to intimidate', professor says as Bondi requests Minnesota records
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Monte Francis, Nadine Strossen, Professor of Constitutional Law at New York Law School and Former President of the ACLU, says that voter rolls 'could definitely be used to intimidate people who are lawfully entitled to vote'. US Attorney General Pam Bondi demanded Minnesota hand over voter registration records in a letter to Governor Tim Waltz amid tensions over ICE deployment in the state.

events.title: Coco Gauff condemns tennis's lack of privacy after she's caught on camera smashing racket
events.description: Coco Gauff has called for more privacy for tennis players after being caught on camera smashing her racket in an off-court players' area following her Australian Open quarter-final loss to Elina Svitolina on Tuesday.

events.title: UK's Starmer heads to China seeking a thaw in relations but risking a rift with Trump
events.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer is heading to China, aiming to improve relations with Beijing amid tensions with the United States

events.title: Mexico vows ‘solidarity’ with Cuba after oil shipment cancellation reports
events.description: The president says Mexico's decision 'to sell or give oil to Cuba for humanitarian reasons' was a 'sovereign' one.

events.title: Why is ‘Cloud Dancer’ the colour of the year?
events.description: We examine the online debate ignited by Pantone’s Colour of the Year, Cloud Dancer.

events.title: Trump’s JPMorgan Chase lawsuit revives debanking concerns in US
events.description: Workers in 'risky' industries and many religious and ethnic groups have been denied access to financial services.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Activists fear U.S. visa restrictions for Palestinians will hurt diplomacy
events.description: Palestinians can no longer apply for a U.S. visa with documents issued by the Palestinian Authority — another sign, they say, that the Trump administration is sidelining Palestinians.

events.title: Activists fear U.S. visa restrictions for Palestinians will hurt diplomacy
events.description: Palestinians can no longer apply for a U.S. visa with documents issued by the Palestinian Authority -- another sign, they say, that the Trump administration is sidelining Palestinians.

events.title: Limited access restored to Syria’s Al Hol camp amid security concerns
events.description: United Nations agencies have regained limited access to Syria’s Al Hol camp and resumed the delivery of essential supplies after days of disruption caused by a volatile security situation, the UN Deputy Spokesperson said on Friday.

events.title: Accused surgeon Michael McKee allegedly lurked at ex-wife's home weeks before double murder: report
events.description: A surgeon allegedly stalked his ex-wife weeks before a Columbus double murder, new court documents reveal. Michael McKee is accused of lurking at the victims' home.

events.title: Russia reportedly slams Trump’s Golden Dome as 'provocative' as trillion-dollar shield takes shape
events.description: Russia reportedly called the U.S. Golden Dome missile defense project "provocative" as an expert says Russia's reaction shows the system's power as a bargaining chip.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: ‘We are just not stopping’: How Minnesotans turned the tables on ICE
events.description: US President Donald Trump’s mass deportation programme has given rise to a social media spectacle of shaved and shackled detainees being rounded up by force. But on the streets of Minneapolis and Saint Paul, thousands of locals have launched their own campaign to document ICE’s often-violent operations, filming masked immigration agents wherever they go.

events.title: ICE agents to have role at Winter Olympics - but told they are 'not welcome'
events.description: ICE agents will have a security role at the Winter Olympics in Italy, it has been revealed, after the man who led the Trump administration's crackdown in Minneapolis was moved out of the city.

events.title: Goma in eastern Congo is hanging by a thread a year after the city fell to Rwanda-backed rebels
events.description: The M23 rebel group still controls Goma, a year after taking the main city in eastern Congo

events.title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP
events.description: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.

events.title: 'Crying horse' toys go viral in China ahead of Lunar New Year
events.description: Shop owners say the frowning toys - originally made in error - are resonating with young workers.

events.title: India and EU announce 'mother of all trade deals'
events.description: The long-awaited deal comes as both Delhi and Brussels contend with economic and geopolitical pressure from the US.

events.title: Sweden aims to lower age of criminal responsibility to 13 as gangs recruit children
events.description: Critics say the proposal could see even younger children becoming offenders as well as breaching children's rights.

events.title: TikTok US pushes back on claims it is censoring content
events.description: Thousands of people claim political content is being suppressed after the US operation was spun off.

events.title: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
events.description: The African nation argues it is owed payments but Downing Street says it will fight the case.

events.title: One Battle After Another leads Bafta nominations
events.description: The political thriller has 14 nominations, with Sinners, Hamnet and Marty Supreme also recognised.

events.title: Trump raises US tariffs on South Korea imports to 25%
events.description: Trump has accused Seoul of "not living up" to a trade deal that was reached last year.

events.title: Japan court orders compensation for migrants lured to North Korea
events.description: The plaintiffs said North Korea was marketed to them as "paradise on Earth".

events.title: 'Major step': French MPs vote in favour of bill to ban social media for under-15s
events.description: If the bill passes the upper house it could take effect by the start of France's new school year in September.

events.title: Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp to trial premium subscriptions
events.description: Under the plan, access to the Meta platforms' core services would remain free.

events.title: Benfica’s Jose to kill Real with love, says Madrid boss ‘like his child’
events.description: Fiery-tempered and fierce-tongued Jose Mourinho softens his tone as former club Real Madrid face crunch game in Benfica.

events.title: See inside the former US embassy in Tehran
events.description: Al Jazeera’s Ali Hashem went to the site where the US-Iranian relationship took a drastic turn for the worse in 1979.

events.title: Palestinian patients wait for reopening of the Rafah border
events.description: Palestinians in need of advanced medical care say they’re hopeful Gaza’s Rafah border with Egypt will reopen soon.

events.title: ‘Mother of all deals’: India, EU broker trade agreement
events.description: India and the European Union have announced a landmark trade deal after two decades of talks, creating a market of two b

events.title: CBS News’ Bari Weiss unveils new strategy amid backlash, viewership lags
events.description: The network is set lean into podcasters bringing on more controversial conservative leaning voices.

events.title: Minnesota judge orders ICE chief to appear in court
events.description: Judge orders head of ICE to explain agency's handling of bond hearings for immigrants it has detained.

events.title: Japan says goodbye to last pandas amid strained ties with China
events.description: Thousands gathered in Tokyo to bid farewell to Japan’s last two pandas as they began their return to China.

events.title: Real Madrid visit Benfica: UEFA Champions League – all to know
events.description: Former Real Madrid manager Jose Mourinho can stifle his former side in must-win UCL match for his current club, Benfica.

events.title: Gauff blasts broadcasters over privacy after Australian Open racket smash
events.description: Coco Gauff, who lost to Elina Svitolina in the quarterfinals of the Australian Open, was filmed smashing her racket.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Canadian ex-Olympian pleads not guilty to 17 felonies including drug trafficking
events.description: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, 44, ‘turned to a life of crime’ after his snowboarding career ended Ryan Wedding, the Canadian former Olympic snowboarder accused of cocaine distribution and orchestrating several murders, appeared on Monday in a southern California courtroom for arraignment. The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. Authorities allege that after his snowboarding career, Wedding “turned to a life of crime” as a narcotics trafficker and led an organization that moved cocaine from South America to the US and Canada. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘I lost part of my heart’: last of Japan’s pandas leave for China as ties fray
events.description: Hundreds at zoo in Tokyo say farewell to Lei Lei and Xiao Xiao, as China ends ‘panda diplomacy’ with Japan Hundreds of people have gathered to say farewell to two popular pandas departing Tokyo for China, leaving Japan without any of the beloved bears for the first time in 50 years, as ties between the Asian neighbours fray. Panda twins Lei Lei and Xiao Xiao were transported by truck out of Ueno zoological gardens, their birthplace, disappointing many Japanese fans who have grown attached to the furry four-year-olds. Continue reading...

events.title: EU signs 'mother of all deals' to boost trade with India
events.description: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.

events.title: India and the EU clinch the 'mother of all deals' in a historic trade agreement
events.description: India and the European Union have reached a free trade agreement, at a time when Washington targets them both with steep import tariffs, pushing major economies to seek alternate partnerships.

events.title: Netherlands set for minority coalition as parties reach deal
events.description: Three Dutch political parties clinched a coalition deal but will have to rely on support from other parties to govern.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.description: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: Nipah virus: India says only 2 cases confirmed as fears rise
events.description: India's government said there were two confirmed cases of Nipah virus since December last year, with all those in contact with the affected people having been quarantined and tested.

events.title: ICE agents spark controversy in Italy over Olympics plans
events.description: A group of American ICE agents is set to travel to Italy and provide additional security to the US delegation during the Winter Olympics. "It's not like the SS are coming," Italy's Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said.

events.title: Dutch court sentences Eritrean migrant smuggler to 20 years
events.description: A Dutch court on Tuesday sentenced Eritrean Amanuel W. to 20 years in prison in the Netherlands' largest migrant smuggling case so far. More suspects are set to appear in court later this year.

events.title: Spain to grant legal status to 500,000 undocumented migrants
events.description: Spain is moving against the European tide with a plan to offer a chance at residency status to hundreds of thousands of undocumented migrants. The move has exposed a deep political divide for the minority government.

events.title: China: Is Xi Jinping losing trust in his top generals?
events.description: A corruption scandal in the People's Liberation Army has rocked China's military. Probes into two of President Xi Jinping's deputies highlight a struggle over loyalty, power and control within the armed forces.

events.title: South Korea's 'fake news' law tests press autonomy
events.description: Critics accuse lawmakers of pushing measures that could stifle a free press, while Seoul says the changes are needed to manage the rapidly evolving media landscape.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.description: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.description: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Germany news: Shadow economy grows to over $500B
events.description: A new study shows the shadow economy in Germany has grown to its highest level in over decade. Meanwhile, Germany has welcomed a new trade agreement between the EU and India.

events.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day: Europe remembers Nazi genocide
events.description: Auschwitz survivor Tatiana Bucci has addressed MEPs in a special session. An event will be held at the Auschwitz-Birkenau memorial in Poland to commemorate the concentration camp's liberation 81 years ago.

events.title: French ex-senator found guilty of spiking MP's drink to sexually assault her
events.description: A French court on Tuesday found former senator Joel Guerriau guilty of spiking lawmaker Sandrine Josso's champagne in November 2023 in order to sexually abuse her. The court sentenced him to four years in prison, of which 18 months must be behind bars.

events.title: The mother of all deals? EU and India sign trade deal two decades in the making
events.description: It has been described as the Mother Of All Deals. But will the accords struck between the EU and India lead to a wider sense of a Happy Family? The signing took place with predictable, and some might say, justifiable fanfare. The headline says it's a free trade festival, 20 years in the planning. Clear and present opportunities for business to go back and forth.

events.title: 'Talk to me, Goose': Starmer teases Macron with Top Gun mock up
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer poked fun at his French counterpart on Tuesday - by putting on a pair of sunglasses at an event before saying, "bonjour".

events.title: Rwanda suing UK over scrapped deportation scheme
events.description: Rwanda is suing the UK for failing to formally terminate the controversial agreement.

events.title: Starmer in China: What will be on the table?
events.description: It doesn't feel all that long ago that David Cameron took the Chinese leader Xi Jinping for a pint in a Buckinghamshire pub.

events.title: 'Narco sub' carrying cocaine seized in the Atlantic Ocean
events.description: British police have helped seize a record nine-tonne haul of cocaine from a "narco sub" in the Atlantic Ocean.

events.title: French lawmaker recounts trauma in trial of ex-senator accused of drugging her with MDMA
events.description: A French lawmaker seeks "the truth” in the trial in Paris of a former senator accused of drugging her to commit sexual assault

events.title: India and EU clinch the 'mother of all deals' in a historic free trade agreement
events.description: India and the European Union have reached a free trade agreement to deepen economic and strategic ties

events.title: India's prime minister says it has reached a free trade agreement with the European Union
events.description: India's prime minister says it has reached a free trade agreement with the European Union

events.title: A Holocaust survivor born in a concentration camp shares her story
events.description: Ilana Kantorowicz Shalem was born in the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp in March 1945, and is one of the youngest Holocaust survivors

events.title: Russia offers cash bonuses, frees prisoners and lures foreigners to replenish its troops in Ukraine
events.description: Russian authorities use various strategies to recruit new troops to replenish its supply of soldiers for its nearly 4-year-old full-scale invasion of Ukraine

events.title: Senegal's aquagym classes offer hope and healing for people with reduced mobility
events.description: Senegal’s first aquagym program has drawn praise from health professionals for helping people with reduced mobility caused by noncommunicable diseases

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: “Giving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,” the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Florida man allegedly tells victim 'sorry... I need to see my grandmother' during armed carjacking
events.description: A masked man, 18, allegedly carjacked a woman at gunpoint in Orange County, Florida, telling her he needed the car to visit his grandmother, authorities said.

events.title: University of Michigan student vanishes from fraternity party in T-shirt during sub-zero night
events.description: University of Michigan student Lucas Mattson, 19, found dead after leaving fraternity party in T-shirt during sub-zero conditions. His body was found after 20-hour search effort.

events.title: California toddler falls out of moving car, mother charged
events.description: Police in California, arrested a mother on felony child abuse charges after viral video showed a 19-month-old child falling from a moving SUV.

events.title: French lawmakers declare 'battle for free minds' after approving social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers paved the way for a bill banning social media for children under 15, following Australia's lead in protecting children from digital harm.

events.title: Witkoff celebrates 'new day in the Middle East' after final Israeli hostage is returned from Gaza
events.description: All hostages from Gaza have returned home as Trump administration completes historic Middle East diplomatic achievement, marking end of painful chapter.

events.title: North Korea launches short-range ballistic missiles into sea, show of force ahead of political meetings
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's regime tests ballistic missiles as tensions rise in the region ahead of a massive political party gathering.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition leader says democratic transition would be 'fall of the Berlin Wall' for Americas
events.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado said she intends to return to Venezuela soon to help drive a democratic transition.

events.title: Israel confirms recovery of last hostage's remains from Gaza
events.description: The remains of Ran Gvili, the final Israeli hostage held by Hamas, have been recovered from Gaza. The police officer died defending Israel on Oct. 7.

events.title: Zelenskyy says US security guarantees document is '100% ready' for signing
events.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy says U.S. security guarantees document is "100% ready" for signing as trilateral peace talks with Russia expected to continue in Abu Dhabi.
